channel.title: Hornet gun in MP
channel.description: One day I was playing HL1 multiplayer and suddenly this idea came in to my head. To me hornet gun isn't a particularily interesting weapon to use in MP because of its randomness: you just spray hornets in all directions without actual aiming and then you can score a cheap kill. What I propose is the mechanism reminiscent of target locking system in guided rockets - before unleashing the swarm of merciless stinging insects on the head of your opponent you will need to hold a crosshair on the enemy for a second or two to lock on.

item.title: Hornet gun in MP
item.dc:creator: JamesKane
item.description:
Nedepp:

The Hornet Gun is fine. I just think they should make the fire rate a little bit faster. I would like it if the secondary was one powerful straight shot but that 'aint gonna happen.

The fire rate seen in the video is slower compared to what it is now.

item.title: Hornet gun in MP
item.dc:creator: JeffMOD
item.description:
In HL, it’s a submodel for the Agrunt, like the weapons on the Hgrunt. While it’s never used in the code, it does mean it’s a weapon.

Read full topic

item.title: Hornet gun in MP
item.dc:creator: Nerdinium
item.description:
Ryλn:

Okay, okay, I figured i would get a clever lil answer like this from you.

A sword or gun is a seperate item used as a weapon. The hivehand is part of the Agrunt. …And it’s other hand does the exact same effects, damage, and actions, except has a vagina for a hand.

All i’m saying is why do they have to have one hivehand when you could make the Agrunts body parts symmetrical.

Unless you have a thing for asymmetric autonamy, give it a thought.

the hive hand connects with the grunt’s arm in some sort of cellular connection between the two bodies , IIRC it says so in “raising the bar” and ya … other people also said that since it was a separate model it’s not a body part

Read full topic

item.title: Hornet gun in MP
item.dc:creator: Grey_Acumen
item.description:
Ryλn:

A sword or gun is a seperate item used as a weapon. The hivehand is part of the Agrunt. …And it’s other hand does the exact same effects, damage, and actions, except has a vagina for a hand.

No it’s not. It’s an item they hold. That’s why the model you find can work separately from them. I’m pretty sure valve has publicly confirmed this too.

Thinking about it more, I can understand the confusion. The Xen factory has the Agrunts popping out of those barrels already wearing the hivehand, as does the Research Lab where you first are introduced to them. (why would the research lab NOT take the Alien Grunt’s weapon from them?) and they only ever hold it in their right hand.

It might be worth considering having it set in Black Mesa so that either the research lab has an Agrunt or two that DON’T have the hivehand equipped, and/or have the Xen factory section actually let you see the process of the Agrunt being equipped with the hivehand and then put into those storage barrels. It would make things a little more clear that the Agrunts aren’t actually grown INSIDE of the barrel.
It would also be nice to see an Agrunt that had the hivehand on the left hand instead of the right hand, but that would actually conflict with the Xen factory idea, since there’s no reason for the factory to mix up which of the Agrunt’s hands it puts the hivehand on.

Read full topic
